sentences.en: At the end of every term a schoolmaster reports on each of his pupils.
sentences.cn: 每学期结束时,教员都要报告每位学生的情况.

sentences.en: He rushed into the schoolmaster's cottage, calling her name.
sentences.cn: 他冲到教师的住处, 喊着她的名字.

sentences.en: He was village schoolmaster for several years.
sentences.cn: 他当了好几年的乡村小学的校长.

sentences.en: His teaching career began as a village schoolmaster.
sentences.cn: 他的教师生涯是从一名乡村小学教师开始的.

sentences.en: That dull schoolmaster so good that he - ? "
The children were awed into silence by the schoolmaster.
sentences.cn: 孩子们被校长吓得说不出话来.

sentences.en: The new schoolmaster has some build!
sentences.cn: 新来的校长体形还挺不错呢!

sentences.en: The schoolmaster heard her with astonishment.
The schoolmaster pushed out the teacher.
The schoolmaster requested a meeting at nine o'clock in the morning.
sentences.cn: 校长要求早上九点钟开会.

sentences.en: The schoolmaster said that he was unable to attend this meeting.
sentences.cn: 校长说他无法出席这次会议.

sentences.en: The schoolmaster sat in his homely dwelling attached to the school.
sentences.cn: 学校的教师坐在和校舍相连的朴素住宅里.

sentences.en: The schoolmaster was a scholarly man. All his pupils looked up to him.
sentences.cn: 校长是个很有学问的人, 他的学生都尊重他.

sentences.en: There remained the schoolmaster - probably now a reverend parson.
sentences.cn: 还有他那位教师哪,也许现在是一位令人敬重的牧师了.

words.tran_cn: 学校教师；烦琐哲学家；教授
女教师（等于schoolma’am）；装出教师派头的人；女学究

trans.tran_cn: 男教师，男教员，教导着，教育者，校长
trans.tran_en: a male teacher, especially in a  private school (= one that parents pay to send their children to )
